page.title: 07THE WINDMILL_TIPTREE
page.content: In July 1985 the eighteen century windmill in Tiptree was up for sale for Â£75,000.It is a grade two listed building.The 60 foot high mill was threatened by demolition in the 1960's.A fight to stop the mill being demolished,even though it was badly decayed was waged. The case for restoring the mill was put before top_ranking government officials and eventually the go_ahead was given. Subsequent owners have restored it and it is now a residence consisting of nine rooms,including two bathrooms,an attic room right at the top and is set in a garden of a third of an acre.
